award_name.ja: 2001年9月 日本金属学会 第11回奨励賞

award_name.en: 2001(September) The encouraging prize, The Japan Institute

paper_title.en: High-pressure synthesis and physical properties of ruthenate-cuprates RuSr(2)LnCu(2)O(8) (Ln = Y, Dy, Ho, Er)

description.en: We report the series of ruthenate-cuprates RuSr2 LnCu(2)O(8) (Ru-1212Ln; Ln = Y, Dy, Ho, Er), which were prepared at 1200-1300 degreesC under 6 GPa. High-purity sample could be obtained for every system with the 'Ru-poor' starting composition, Ru(0.9)Sr(2)LnCu(2)O(7.8). It was confirmed that a solid solution of (Ru1-x,Cu-x)Sr2YCu2Oy exists and its range terminates at x similar to 0.1 without formation of the stoichiometric phase of RuSr2YCu2Oy. Many Y-based samples were prepared varying the Ru/Cu ratio and the oxygen contents. According to DC susceptibility measurements, ferromagnetism and superconductivity looked to coexist below approximately 40 K in some samples. However, DC resistivity was always quite high even when a sample showed a large diamagnetism in a low temperature region. These results may suggest phase separation regarding the Ru/Cu ratio in the solid solution of (Ru1-x,Cu-x)Sr2YCu2Oy, casting doubt for the coexistence of superconductivity and ferromagnetism. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C-SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND ITS APPLICATIONS

paper_title.en: Bulk superconductivity in Ru0.9Sr2YCu2.1O7.9

description.en: An Ru0.9Sr2YCu2.1O7.9 sample synthesized by high-pressure high-temperature solid-state reaction underwent (weak) ferromagnetic transition at similar to150 K followed by a bulk superconducting transition at similar to30 K. It showed a clear Meissner signal in the field-cooled process up to external magnetic field of a few hundred Oe (similar to300 Oe). These results appear to indicate coexistence of bulk superconductivity and ferromagnetism. At the same time, both magnetic-susceptibility and hysteresis data can be interpreted as mere superimposition of superconducting diamagnetic and (weak) ferromagnetic responses without any anomalous behavior. The genuine coexistence of bulk superconductivity and ferromagnetism in this compound might not yet be conclusive.

publication_name.en: PHYSICAL REVIEW B

paper_title.en: High-pressure synthesis of oxyfluoride superconductors, Sr2Can-1CunO2n+delta F2 (n=4, 5)

description.en: We prepared oxyfluoride superconductors, Sr2Ca3Cu4O8+deltaF2 and Sr2Ca4Cu5O10+deltaF2 at 1250 degreesC under 5.5 GPa. These phases are the n = 4, 5 members of a homologous series, Sr2Can-1CunO2n+deltaF2 [02(n-1)-F] reported previously. X-ray studies indicated that they have tetragonal structures with a = 3.851(1)), c = 32.35(1) Angstrom for n = 4 and a = 3.852(1), c = 38.77(1) Angstrom for n = 5. In the former phase, T-c varied very widely depending on oxygen and fluorine contents from 40 to 95 K. On the other hand, T-c was almost constant near 40 K in the latter phase.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: High-pressure syntheses of series of high Tc-superconductors (Cu,X)Sr2Can-1CunOy (X=Ge,P,C,S)

description.en: We prepared several series of superconductors under high pressure in which blocking layers are occupied by Cu and other elements; they are (Cu,X)Sr2Can-1CunOy (X = Ge, P, C, S, n = 3 - 7). In the case of X = Ge, Cu and Ge are distributed randomly in the blocking layer giving tetragonal lattices. When X = P, S, Cu and X are placed in ordered way, while both random and ordered arrangements appear for X = C. All these series include members whose Tc are higher or close to 90 K.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: High pressure synthesis and superconducting properties of Sr2Can-1CunOy (n=1-4) and Sr2Can-1CunO2n+delta F2+/-y (n=2-5)

description.en: We prepared two series of superconductors, Sr2Can-1CunOy (02(n-1)n; n=1 similar to 4) and Sr2Can-1CunO2n+deltaF2+/-y (02(n-1)n-F; n=2,3) under high pressure and investigated their superconducting properties. The former series were prepared under 5 similar to 6 GPa. The n=1 member, Sr2CuO3+delta is not superconducting, while the n=2 similar to 4 members show superconducting transitions at 77, 109 and 83 K, respectively. The latter series were prepared at 1250 degrees C under 5.5 GPa and showed T-c of 99 K (n=2), 111 K (n=3) and similar to 40 K (n=4, 5). In this series, T-c was dependent on both the oxygen and fluorine contents.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: Superconductivity in the series of compounds Sr2Can-1CunOy (n=1 similar to 4) prepared under high pressure

description.en: A series of compounds Sr2Can-1CunOy (n = 1-4) were prepared under 5-6 GPa and their superconducting properties were examined. The n = 1 member of the series, Sr2CuO3+delta, has been believed as a superconductor with T-c of 70 K. However, our experiments suggest strongly that it is not superconducting but the 70 K superconductivity is ascribed to the n = 2 member of the series, Sr2CaCu2Oy. The n = 3 and 4 members were also prepared and they were confirmed to have T-c's of 109 and 83 K, respectively.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: New oxyfluoride superconductors Sr2Can-1CunO2n+delta F2+/-y (n=2; T-c=99 K, n=3; T-c=111 K) prepared at high pressure

description.en: We prepared new oxyfluoride superconductors, Sr2CaCu2O4+deltaF2+/-y and Sr2Ca2Cu3O6+deltaF2+/-y, at 1250 degrees C under 5.5 GPa. These phases are the n = 2, 3 members of a homologous series, Sr2Can-1CunO2n+deltaF2+/-y, respectively, in which the n = 1 phase was reported previously. X-ray and HRTEM studies indicated that they have tetragonal structures with a = 3.843(1), c = 19.88(1) Angstrom for n = 2 and a = 3.840(1), c = 26.17(1) Angstrom for n = 3. The n = 2 phase showed a superconducting transition at 99 K, while the n = 3 one at 111 K.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: Superconductivity of M-12(n-1)n series of compounds prepared under high pressure

description.en: In this paper, we discuss several series of superconductors, MA2Caa-1CuaO2n+3 (M-12(n-1)n, M=(Cu,C), (Cu,S), (Cu,P), (Cu,Ge), B, A1, Ga, A=Ba or Sr) which are stable only under high pressure condition. Each series includes members having Tc above 100 K. Tc is only slightly dependent on the constituent cation in the blocking layer. For instance, M-1234 phases with M=B, AI, Ga have Tc's near 110 K in spite of large differences in ionic radius of the M ion.

publication_name.en: Czechoslovak Journal of Physics

paper_title.en: HIGH-RESOLUTION ELECTRON-MICROSCOPE ANALYSIS OF NEW-TYPE OF SUPERCONDUCTORS IN A BA-CA-CU-C-O OXYCARBONATE SYSTEM

description.en: A new homologous series of oxycarbonate superconductors with ideal compositions (Cu0.5C0.5)(m)Bam+1Can-1CunOy, where m=1 & 2; n=3, 4 (and 5 for m=2), are prepared in a Ba-Ca-Cu-C-O system under high pressure of around 5 Gpa, and their structures are revealed by HRTEM. Both (Cu,C)-1223 (T-c=67K) and 1234 (T-c=117K) consist of BaO-[Cu,C]O-BaO blocks sandwiched by Ca-n-1(CuO2)(n) infinite-layer like blocks. Structures of (Cu,C)-2334 (T-c=113K) and 4679 (2334+2345), on the other hand, consists of thicker blocks of BaO-[Cu,C]O-BaO-[Cu,C]O-BaO, also sandwiched by the Ca-n-1(CuO2)(n) type blocks. Superstructures with dual periodicity a=2a(t) due to ordering of Cu and C within the [Cu,C]O layers are commonly observed. Anti-phase relations of Cu and C positions along the c-direction are observed in (Cu,C)-1223, 1234 and 2323 phases with c=2c(t) while in-phase relations are observed in (Cu,C)-2334 and 4679 (2334+2345) phases with c=c(t).

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: A NEW OXYCARBONATE SUPERCONDUCTOR (CU0.5C0.5)(2)BA3CA2CU3O11 (T-C=91-K) PREPARED AT HIGH-PRESSURE

description.en: We prepared a new oxycarbonate superconductor, (Cu0.5C0.5)(2)Ba3Ca2Cu3O11 at 1250 degrees C under 5 GPa. This phase is the m=2 and n=3 member of a homologous series, (Cu0.5C0.5)(m)Bam+1Can-1CunO2m+2n+1 reported previously. Its X-ray pattern could be indexed assuming a tetragonal subcell with a=3.852(1), c=18.61(2) Angstrom. Electron microscopic observations indicated ordering between Cu and C in the (Cu, C) plane, resulting in a superlattice, a(s)=2a, b(s)=b and c(s)=2c with respect to the tetragonal subcell. This new member showed a superconducting transition at 91 K.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

paper_title.en: OXYGEN DEFICIENCY AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN ND2-XCEXCUO4

description.en: The relationship between temperature and the oxygen-defect concentration in Nd2-xCexCuO4 was investigated in detail under an oxygen pressure of 10(-3) atm. The effect of the oxygen defects on superconductivity was studied for the range of Ce-content O.14 less than or equal to x less than or equal to 0.175. In a sample with x=O.15 or 0.16, a lesser amount of oxygen defects was needed to realize superconductivity compared with the case x=0.14. This suggests that introduction of oxygen defects works to add carriers (electrons) to the system. Oxygen defects, however, play some role in superconductivity besides carrier doping. The a-dimension of the present tetragonal system is well described by a function of the number of electrons doped i.e., oxygen-defect doping has the same effect on a as Ce-doping does.

publication_name.en: PHYSICA C

research_project_title.ja: 機能性遷移金属酸化物の探索と開発
research_project_title.en: Materials research and development for functional transition metal oxides

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

institution_name.ja: 独立行政法人物質・材料研究機構

description.ja: 本課題の研究目的は、遷移金属酸化物を主な対象として、(1)超常環境下における物質探索、(2)構造、物性評価と新現象の探索、の2つを実施して、新規物質や新現象・新機能の探索・開発を行うことであった。その結果、10個以上の新規遷移金属酸化物の開発に成功し、それらの特異な特性を明らかにした。一部は新規材料シーズとして有用と思われる。
description.en: We have conducted new materials research under high-pressure and high-temperature conditions for various transition metal oxide to develop materials properties toward possible applications as well as greater understanding for solid state science. The aim was achieved in part by successful synthesis of new materials, more than 10, and by identifying those crystal structures and magnetic and electrical properties. Some of them are likely applicable for practical uses.

research_project_title.ja: 超高圧環境を利用したホウ素ドープ超伝導ダイヤモンド結晶の合成
research_project_title.en: Synthesis of boron doped diamond under high pressure environment

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

institution_name.ja: 独立行政法人物質・材料研究機構

description.ja: 本研究では、炭酸塩を触媒とするダイヤモンド高圧合成法を新たに適用することにより、これまでに報告された圧力・温度よりも低い条件下でホウ素ドープ超伝導ダイヤモンド結晶が再現良く合成出来ることを明らかにした。合成されたダイヤモンドの超伝導転移温度(T_c)は最大10.3Kを示し、この値はこれまでに報告された高圧合成ダイヤモンドの超伝導転移温度の最高値である。
description.en: In this study, we adopted the new high-pressure synthetic technique, which carbonate is used as diamond producing catalysts, and achieved to prepare the boron doped superconducting diamond crystal under lower P-T condition reported before. Our sample showed maximum superconducting transition temperature (T_c) at 10.3 K, which is the highest T_c ever reported about high-pressure synthetic diamond.
